review_blob: Awesome fruit sour. Aroma is berry, roasted malts, some vinegar and  yogurt. Taste is vinegar too, cherry, dried fruits, acidic and tart. Surprisingly easy to drink in its complexity.
beer_name: Birrificio del Ducato My Blueberry Nightmare

review_blob: Im not a fan of rhubarb, but this one was special. Some fruitness, wood notes and leather at nose. Flavor is sour, lemony with high tartness, low body and oily texture, fizzy.
Deep dark brown colour, white head. High malty, fruity, caramel, almost sweet and a bit of bitterness. Medium body.
Dark brown body, roasty nose, small tan head. Aroma and taste are moderately sweet, medium bitterness, chocolate notes, a hint of coconut. Medium body.
Pours a clear gold color with a sod lasting white head. Slight hoppy aroma. Hop flavor and mellow bitterness. Medium to low body.
Pale golden appearance white head. Aroma is soft, malts, bread and grain. Taste is soft, honey, grain, bread. Low body.
Dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma is dark fruits, caramel and grain. Taste is dark ripe fruits, caramel, dark malts and brown sugar. Medium body.
Quite dark color, medium foam. Aroma is caramellish and toffee, some bready yeast. Flavour is too sweet for me. Medium body.
beer_name: Bottleworks Van den Vern Grand Cru

review_blob: Dark brown colour with brown foam. Aroma is malty, quite sweet, with coffe and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts, hops in the end.
Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of nice citrus and hops, light bready malts. Flavour is moderatly sweet, with a bitter finish. Light to medium bodied.
Dark brown appearance. Aroma and taste are sweet, malty but not good. Some infections detected.
Deep ambery brown colour, medium foam. Aroma is malts and hops. Flavour is fruity, spiced and hopped!
Dark orange, apple aroma, some fruited notes, full bodied in the mouth is rich and complex, very well balanced. great.
Dark brown-black color, vast & fresh foam. Deep aroma of roasted malts, very well balanced in mouth feelings, nice!
Dark orange, quite foamy. Richly fruity aroma, malty and sweet with notes of light brown sugar and spices. Flavor of malts, sweet, with a fruits and spices and finishing bittersweet.
Pours black with white-off head. Aroma of roasted malts, very dry and sweet. Medium body and watery.
Pours gold with a large white head. Aroma of malt and yeaste, light hops. Taste is strong with yeast, some bitterness and citric notes.
dark orange, maybe brown. The aroma and taste are sweet, with no bitterness. Medium body
Pours deep red, white head. Aroma has smoked notes, caramel and fruity. Flavor is rich grainy bread, some mild. Finish is bitter.
Amber colour, off-white creamy head. Aroma is malty, light fruity and some hops. Tatse is ok. The body is medium to low.
tap. Dark color, short head. Aroma is fruity. Flavour is fruity too, very acid. Full body over the palate.
Dark watery appearance, no foam. Aroma and taste are light, nothing special. Roasted malts are not evident. Not cool at all.
Brown-black color, with a creamy head. Aroma has lots of smoke, heavy! Full taste of smoked malts. Powerful body.
bottle, brown appearance, white foam. Very spicey aroma with fruits and apple. Good taste, simply delicious. Light body with high carbonation and drinkable.
Hazy yellow body, white head. Light smoky cereal aroma with meal. Taste is smokey, bitter, some mild. Aftertaste has fruity notes.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: Bottle. Aroma of dark ripe fruits, with wheat and malt. Very sweet, then bit of acid and tanginess. Light hoppiness, though mild. Moderate aftertaste.
Purs dark reddish brown, foamy head. Aroma of sweet malts, heavy sweetness. Taste is mainly malty. Very nice one.
Clear yellow, foamy head. Aroma of cereal, floral hops and caramel, bready and fresh. Soft carbonation.

Pours a deep red with a tan head. Aromas of malt, caramel, banana, brown sugar, with touch of peat.
In mouth its creamy, a bit watery and fresh. Not sure the temperature was right. The body is medium-hig.
A very good beer indeed.

Dark brown, tan creamy head. Strong sweet, caramelly chocolate aroma that lasts.
Flavour is sweet, hops in the end. A great sweet stout, probably the best I had since I use to drink beer.

Just respect for the oldest brewery in the world.
This is not my favourity stile, but Ive to admit this beer is super.
Dark amber one with off-white foam. Aroma is nice, dark fruits, malt and a marked smell of banana,
very typical in this kind of beer. Some yeasts. Flavour is sweet, with medium body and a medium carbonation.
Medium coppery red. Aroma of malt, chocolate, carmel, toffee and citrusy hops. Rich flavour of dark fruits, caramel, with a lot of bitterness in the end. Modest doby but nice, not much carbonated.

Sweet booze aroma, sweet and roastiness. The flavor starts with chocolate, dark fruits, brown sugar, then bourbon, roastiness, with a long end. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, very creamy at mouthfeel.

Brown appearance, creamy off-white head. It smells softly, malty with a hoppy dominant oddity. Taste is somehow different from olfactory sensation.
I perceive light malt, brown sugar, herbs, gum, resin. Overriding hoppyness. Very complex.

Pale gold lambik, slim crispy foam on head. Aroma is moderate yeasty.
Sourness is balanced with a note of light sweetness. Not as balanced as foeder, but nice. Moderate acid, medium citric - grapefruits - and tart. Sharp biting citric sourness in the end. Watery texture. Completely flat.
